[[File:Villager becoming Witch.gif|thumb|Villagers converting to witches is an example of mob conversion.]]
'''Mob conversion''' is a game mechanic whereby certain [[mob]]s can convert to mobs of a different [[mob type|type]], or to a different [[mob variant|variant]] of the same type of mob, under specific circumstances.

== List of mob conversions ==
=== Mob type conversions ===
In these instances, a mob converts to another [[mob type|type]] of mob. {{IN|JE}}, data is transferred according to [[#Data transfer]].

== Data transfer ==
{{exclusive|Java|section=1}}
<!--The list below should be accurate of [[25w41a]] and later-->
A mob which converts to another mob retains the following entity data, provided that the new mob is able to make use of said data:<ref group=note>The initial version of this list was provided by Mojang in the [[24w37a]] changelog</ref>

* <code>AbsorptionAmount</code>
* <code>active_effects</code>
* <code>Age</code>
* <code>angry_at</code>
* <code>anger_end_time</code>
* <code>Brain.memories.minecraft:angry_at.ttl</code>{{Needs testing|Still the case post-25w41a?}}
* <code>Brain.memories.minecraft:angry_at.value</code>{{Needs testing|Still the case post-25w41a?}}
* <code>CanBreakDoors</code>
* <code>CanPickUpLoot</code>
* <code>CustomName</code>
* <code>CustomNameVisible</code>
* <code>drop_chances</code>
* <code>fall_distance</code>
* <code>FallFlying</code>
* <code>Fire</code>
* <code>ForcedAge</code>
* <code>HurtByTimestamp</code>
* <code>HurtTime</code>
* <code>Invulnerable</code>
* <code>IsBaby</code>
* <code>Leash</code>
* <code>LeftHanded</code>
* <code>Motion</code>
* <code>NoAI</code>
* <code>NoGravity</code>
* <code>OnGround</code>
* <code>Passengers</code>
* <code>PersistenceRequired</code>
* <code>PortalCooldown</code>
* <code>Position</code>
* <code>RootVehicle</code>
* <code>Rotation</code>
* <code>Silent</code>
* <code>sleeping_pos</code>
* <code>Tags</code>
* <code>Team</code>

Notably, the following fields are ''not'' retained:
* <code>attributes</code>
* <code>Brain</code>, except for the sub-fields mentioned above{{Needs testing|Still the case post-25w41a?}}
* <code>Gossips</code>
* <code>Health</code><ref group=note>The health of the converted mob is set to the same percentage of max health as the original mob had before conversion.</ref>
* Loot tables
* <code>UUID</code>
* <code>VillagerData</code>
* <code>Xp</code>

Additionally, <code>equipment.saddle</code> is not retained when a saddled pig converts to a zombified piglin.<ref>{{bug|MC-304420}}</ref>

===Mobs which split into several upon death===
A related case to mob conversion is where a mob (specifically a [[slime]] or [[magma cube]]) splits into several mobs upon death. In terms of entity data, this is treated as a conversion except that the following fields are additionally ''not'' transferred:
* <code>drop_chances</code>
* <code>equipment</code>
* <code>fall_distance</code>
* <code>FallFlying</code>
* <code>HurtByTimestamp</code>
* <code>HurtTime</code>
* <code>Leash</code>
* <code>Motion</code>
* <code>OnGround</code>
* <code>Passengers</code>
* <code>Position</code>
* <code>Rotation</code>
* <code>sleeping_pos</code>
